TITLE: Millions of student loan borrowers are closer to being debt-free. What to know about the changes
SUMMARY: Here's what borrowers need to know about the U.S. Department of Education's plans to overhaul the student loan system.

TITLE: Cuts to unemployment benefits didn’t spur jobs, report says
SUMMARY: Federal unemployment benefits don't appear to have been a big contributor to labor shortages in 2021, according to the Federal Reserve Bank of San Francisco.

TITLE: Getting close to retirement? Be sure your plan includes managing this risk
SUMMARY: As you get closer to joining the ranks of retirees, it's important that your investment portfolio is allocated in a way that combats "sequence of returns" risk.

TITLE: 74% of people do not think they will ever achieve high net worth status, survey finds
SUMMARY: Achieving high net worth status seems out of reach to many people, a survey finds. Calculating your bottom line can be the first step to becoming wealthier.

TITLE: Stocks are dropping. What should you do?
SUMMARY: April has been an unhappy months for stocks. Here's what to think about before selling, though.

TITLE: Here’s what to do if you missed the April 18 tax filing deadline
SUMMARY: If you missed the April 18 tax deadline, you may cut back on penalties by filing your return promptly. Here's everything late filers need to know.

TITLE: Nearly 1 in 4 students in the U.S. has access to personal finance education this year
SUMMARY: "We've really seen some great progress in terms of guaranteed access," said Christian Sherrill, director of growth and advocacy at Next Gen Personal Finance.

TITLE: Experts advise teens to take a careful hands-on approach when learning about crypto investing
SUMMARY: Experts say new investors don't need to shy away from cryptocurrency but should educate themselves to be protected from volatility.

TITLE: Supreme Court decision may hurt Puerto Rico residents who need access to federal disability program, expert says
SUMMARY: Efforts to expand Supplemental Security Income benefits to U.S. territories suffered a setback  on Thursday.

TITLE: Inflation is impacting health-care costs in retirement. Here's how to fight it
SUMMARY: A short-term rise in health-care inflation can add costs over the long term.

TITLE: Hit with an unexpected tax bill? It’s time to adjust your withholdings
SUMMARY: If you had a surprise bill this tax-filing season, it may be time to adjust your withholdings, according to financial experts. Here’s what to know.

TITLE: 72% of six-figure earners are men, while 57% of workers making under $25,000 are women, survey finds
SUMMARY: Inflation is making it harder to get by without a six-figure salary. But most high earners are men, research shows.

TITLE: Consumer complaints up 31% since 2018 about collection attempts for medical debt not actually owed, federal watchdog finds
SUMMARY: The report from the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau comes as the agency explores ways to mitigate the impact that medical debt can have on consumer credit.

TITLE: How to make sure you're taking advantage of all employer benefits to boost your wealth
SUMMARY: "There's a huge value to the employee for those benefits," said Sherri Bockhorst, senior vice president of innovation and strategy at Businessolver.

TITLE: Supreme Court rejects challenge to SALT limit from New York, New Jersey
SUMMARY: The U.S. Supreme Court has rejected a challenge from New York and other states to overturn the $10,000 limit on the federal deduction for state and local taxes.

TITLE: Inflation is taking a big bite from retirees' pension income
SUMMARY: Pensions' cost-of-living adjustments largely aren't keeping up with inflation. The dynamic is most acute for state and local government retirees, experts said.

TITLE: What we learned from the Biden, Harris tax returns, according to experts
SUMMARY: President Joe Biden and Vice President Kamala Harris have released their 2021 tax returns. Here are a few key takeaways, according to experts.

TITLE: Here are the sacrifices young adults have made to pay their student loans
SUMMARY: Saving for emergencies and retirement top the list of financial decisions most often delayed because of student loan debt.

TITLE: 'Don't immediately reach for your checkbook.' Here's what to do when relatives ask you for money
SUMMARY: When a relative comes to you asking for financial help, it's only natural to feel overwhelmed. Here's how experts recommend proceeding.

TITLE: Here's how to get the most money towards college
SUMMARY: There are ways to get more financial aid or negotiate for additional scholarship money towards a college education.

TITLE: Education Department changes will bring 3.6 million people closer to loan forgiveness
SUMMARY: Millions of student loan borrowers will be closer to debt forgiveness after a number of changes the Education Department plans to make to the lending system.

TITLE: A $1 million winning Powerball ticket will expire soon. Here's how much lottery players leave on the table
SUMMARY: Whether due to losing a ticket, not checking it closely or some other mishap, lottery winners have left millions of dollars unclaimed over the years.

TITLE: These states are poised to pass personal finance education legislation this year
SUMMARY: Georgia will likely be the next state to pass a personal finance education mandate, according to a bill tracker from nonprofit group Next Gen Personal Finance.

TITLE: You can't contribute to a health savings account once you're on Medicare. A bipartisan bill in Congress would change that
SUMMARY: A bipartisan House bill revives past efforts to let individuals on Medicare contribute to health savings accounts, or HSAs, which they currently can't do.

TITLE: Without stimulus checks or child tax credit payments, many Americans can’t afford emergency expenses. One work benefit could help address that
SUMMARY: The onset of Covid-19 prompted a sudden drop in income for many Americans. If that were to happen again, many would still be unprepared, a poll finds.

TITLE: Here’s what to know on Tax Day if you still haven’t filed your return
SUMMARY: April 18 is the 2021 federal tax deadline for most Americans. Here's what to know before filing an extension or sending your return.

TITLE: How to decide whether to spend or save your tax refund
SUMMARY: For most Americans, a tax refund is an opportunity to shore up a safety net. If your savings is on track, put a portion toward something that makes you happy.

TITLE: Here's the type of insurance you'll need at each stage of life, experts say
42% of women investors say they got started during the pandemic, survey shows
SUMMARY: In addition to joining the ranks of investors, many women also are putting their money to work outside of their retirement accounts, research shows.

TITLE: As inflation continues to squeeze Americans, here are 3 ways retirees can cope with higher prices
SUMMARY: Consumer prices jumped 8.5% in March from a year ago. Here's how retirees can cope with higher prices amid rising inflation.
